result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Michelle A. Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: defendant deceased

Defendant Michelle A. Krueger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1, 2 & 3 in 14CF67.  14CM18 to be dismissed.    Upon the defendant's plea and prior to adjudication, defendant will enter into a Deferred Prosecution Agreement for a period of: 24 months with conditions on Ct. 1.
Atty Gumz agrees and enters a No Contest plea.  Defendant agrees.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 & 3.
Court accepts defendant's plea and approves the 24 month DPA with conditions on Ct. 1.  14CM18 to be dismissed.

Court received information from the defendant's counselors.
Atty Hendee makes recommendations and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Atty Gumz asks the court to seal the information provided for the defendant's counseling.  Atty 
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  24 month DPA with conditions.
Cts. 2 & 3:  Withhold Sentence; 24 month Probation with conditions; concurrent:
Court Costs = $243.00 on counts 2 & 3
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
Credit = 13 days if the defendant gets revoked
Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.
14CM18 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee has no objection to sealing the 3 documents listing the defendant's counseling.
BY THE COURT:  Court will seal the counseling documents.
Return date at 09-03-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Michelle A. Krueger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 tracking with:
Atty Hendee states that there has been many discussions with Atty Gumz regarding resolution.  Atty Gumz states that his client is going through treatment and requests another return date.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Return date at 08-20-2015 01:45 pm

Defendant Michelle A. Krueger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 & 14CF67 tracking:
Atty Gumz states that there still may be resolution and the defendant does continue counseling.  Atty Gumz asks for a return.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Status conference at 07-23-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Michelle A. Krueger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states there is not a resolution on this case.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters Not Guilty plea on defendant's behalf.
BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Return date on January 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Mark J. Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 & 14CF67 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that he was contacted by his client last week and she is in treatment in Oshkosh.  Atty Gumz is not yet at resolution but are very close.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset on the matter due to the defendant being in treatment for 90 days.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Return date on November 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michelle A Krueger in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 tracking with
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the Preliminary hearing today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and will waive her rights to a Prelim.
  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea and asks for a return date.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for return.
bond continued.
14CM18 will continue to track
  Return date scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Motion hearing on September 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Michelle A Krueger in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Defendant Michelle A Krueger in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF67 & 14CM18:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive time limits for the Prelim on 14CF67.  
14CM18:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz asks that the two track together.

bond continued in both matters.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 28, 2014 at 10:15 am.

*No conditions
**Bond covers both 14CF67 & 14CM18**

Defendant Michelle A Krueger in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CM18 & 14CF67:
Atty Hendee states charges.    Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Atty Hendee states that there is a warrant on 14CM18 also.  Atty Hendee requests a $1,000 cash bond to cover both cases.  
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant states that she got her dates mixed up.  Defendant is not employed at this time. Cathy Gurnstein (mother) makes a statement to the court.
Defendant asks for a lower bond.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 cash bond that covers both cases.

Defendant will contact the PD office. Time limits not waived by the defendant.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Prelim.
Time limits not waived.
14CF67 should be set for Prelim.
14CM18 to track with.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 28, 2014 at 10:15 am.
